intro: Eranthemum filiforme, commonly known as the threadleaf eranthemum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens for its delicate foliage and vibrant blooms.
